fullText: This production, which is the equivalent of a disco-themed karaoke party, just makes me feel disappointed.
dtliExcerpt: This production, which is the equivalent of a disco-themed karaoke party, just makes me feel disappointed.
bwwExcerpt: This rendition of “The Wiz,” which arrives on Broadway following short engagements in multiple cities and is directed by Schele Williams (“The Notebook”), has the look and feel of a second-rate, low-budget touring production, with tacky, Halloween-quality costumes, limited scenic design (relying heavily on projections), and surprisingly uninspired and generic dance choreography. More thought seems to have gone into the alcoholic drinks available at intermission, including a green-colored frozen
